result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose De Jesus Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
No violent contact with victim. No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose De Jesus Acevedo

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:36 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose De Jesus Acevedo in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Jose De Jesus Acevedo. 
Atty Mistrioty recites agreement; guilty to Count 1, withheld sentence, 1 year probation; $100 fine plus costs, no alcohol, no weapons, no drugs/paraphernalia, AODA assessment and follow through, counseling as recommended, restitution if any, DNA sample and surcharge, No violent contact with K.P.K. (7/23/92), may not request early termination of probation. 
Deft enters guilty plea to Count 1 with repeater. 
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Court gives warning to deportation. 
Court accepts joint recommendation.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose De Jesus Acevedo not in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Jose De Jesus Acevedo. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose De Jesus Acevedo in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Jose De Jesus Acevedo. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose De Jesus Acevedo not in court.  Attorney Timothy Mistrioty in court for Jose De Jesus Acevedo. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defense has received offer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Timothy Mistrioty appeared.  Vivien L. TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:08 a.m. Appearances made. Authorization on file. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Mistrioty that he has gone over the charges and penalties with the defendant and enters not guilty pleas on his behalf. Asks for 60 days. Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jose D Acevedo in court.  Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin.  Right to attorney options form given to defendant.  Defendant referred to SPD.  State needs additional time.  Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH K.D.K. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
